trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of gender on perioperative thermoregulation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of gender on perioperative thermoregulation in patients undergoing general anaesthesia

interventions.interventions: Body temperature changes observed perioperatively during both men and women are under general anaesthesia and postanesthetic shivering seen at the end of the operation after extubation was evaluated by 4 degree scale in five minutes at recovery room.

primaryOutcome.outcome: peroperative body temparature changes monitored continuously with transdermal heat probes.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: monitored continuously when participant is under general anaesthesia

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Postanesthetic shivering was evaluated by 4 degree scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at the end of the operation after extubation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients ages between 18-45 who received general anesthesia for elective surgey
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: oral contraceptive pills usage morbid obesity Younger than 18 years old Elder than 45 years old

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Istanbul Research and Education Hospital Kasap Ilyas district Org.Abdurrahman Nafiz Gurman street Postal code:34098 FATIH/ ISTANBUL

ethicsAndSummary.summary: perioperative thermoregulation and postanesthetic shivering grade were observed in both men and women who received general ansthesia
